title: Congenital Erythropoietic Porphyria (CEP): Clinical Overview
short_description: Clinical document describing congenital erythropoietic porphyria, a rare inherited metabolic disorder caused by enzyme deficiency in the heme biosynthetic pathway.
long_description: This clinical document provides a comprehensive overview of congenital erythropoietic porphyria (CEP), a very rare autosomal recessive metabolic disorder affecting the heme biosynthetic pathway. The document details the pathophysiology involving deficient uroporphyrinogen III cosynthase (UROS) enzyme function, leading to excessive porphyrin accumulation in various tissues. It describes the characteristic photosensitivity symptoms, including skin blistering, scarring, and potential deformities following light exposure. The document also covers the genetic inheritance pattern, epidemiology affecting both sexes equally, and notes that over 200 cases have been documented worldwide, making this a valuable reference for understanding this rare genetic condition.
